title: Old Blackletter font - early 90s
content:
![](http://web.archive.org/web/20150414174310im_/http:/typophile.com/files/font_3726.jpg)

This is to my knowledge one of the first computerized Blackletter fonts, with a quite short lifespan due to being replaced by more elaborate versions such as the regular Old English / Cloister Black. But I know it's still out there somewhere! ;)

People have pointed me towards Stencil Old English Lucinda and Cloister Black, of which it is neither.
author: BartholomeusRex

comments.content: It looks to be stretched 'Laser London' by Bill Ware. The original Mac PS font with documentation can be had [here](http://web.archive.org/web/20150414174310/http:/www.erik.co.uk/font/arty.html). A bit about its history [here](http://web.archive.org/web/20150414174310/https:/68kmla.org/wiki/File:London.ttf.gz).
